Spell Resonance: This item hums ominously with suppressed energy. When casting Force spells, there is a chance that you will gain a +20 alchemical bonus to Force Spell Power for 30 seconds. When casting Sonic spells, there is a chance that you will gain a +20 alchemical bonus to Sonic Spell Power 30 seconds.
%b1 Spell Save %v1: This item gives a %v1 %b1 bonus to your saves versus spells.
Spell Singer: This item in one of two pieces of the Spell Singer set. When both items are equipped you gain two additional bard songs after resting.
Spell Turmoil: When casting any damaging Fire, Cold, Acid or Electric spells, there is a chance that you will gain a +20 Alchemical bonus to Spell Power to one of those energy types for 30 seconds.
Spike Guard: On Being Hit in Melee: 5% chance to do 510 to 700 Piercing Damage to the Attacker.
Spiked: This weapon is studded with vicious spikes, causing it to deal piercing damage in addition to its normal damage types.
Spikes: The sharp spikes on this item deal an additional 1 to 6 Piercing damage when used to strike an enemy.
Spike-Studded: This item is reinforced with metal studs that improve your unarmed strikes. Your unarmed attacks do an additional 1 to 4 piercing damage.
Stabbing 6: The edges of this weapon are serrated, dealing an additional 6d6 piercing damage on each critical hit.
Stabbing 15: The edges of this weapon are serrated, dealing an additional 15d6 piercing damage on each critical hit.
Stability: This item grants a +2 Deflection bonus to AC and a +2 Resistance bonus to saving throws for characters of True Neutral alignment.

Stalwart Defender: This item in one of two pieces of the Stalwart Defender set. When both items are equipped you gain 15% additional threat from Melee attacks. If you have the Stalwart Defender Core 3 Enhancement, this item will grant a +2 AC Bonus. This bonus stacks with all existing bonuses.
Starter: Starter equipment cannot be traded, sold or crafted.

Stealer of Souls: Blackrazor hungers for the Souls of those you have defeated. On a Vorpal hit with this weapon, Blackrazor will absorb some of its Soul, draining one level from the target. When you strike the killing blow on an enemy, Blackrazor retains one Defeated Soul, up to a maximum of 5. Each Defeated Soul grants you +1 Profane bonus to Melee Power and +1 Profane bonus to Damage. If you block or unequip Blackrazor, the Defeated Souls will be released. Defeated Souls last for 30 seconds.
Stealth Strike: Reduces the threat generated by ranged attacks and spells by 15%.

Steam: This weapon is constantly building a magical steam within. When the weapon is used, this pressure can be violently discharged, periodically damaging enemies with an additional 2 to 16 plus 8 points of untyped damage on a successful hit.
Stench: This weapon creates a near paralyzing stench. On critical hits the target becomes nauseous, severely slowing its movement rate.
Sticky Goo Guard: This item has a chance of encasing a creature in sticky goo, much like an attack of a mimic. It reduces the creatures move speed and attack speed.
Stone Paws: In Animal Form, Gain +2[W] and DR 15/Adamantine.

Stone Prison: This weapon is invested with the power of the earth. On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit it will attempt to turn the target to stone, as the Flesh to Stone spell. A successful Fortitude save (DC 27) negates this effect.
Stone Prison Guard: This item has a chance to turn those who hit you to stone. A successful Fortitude save (DC 17) will negate this effect.

Stormreaver's Thunderclap: This item crackles with power, flickers of lightning emanating from it. On a Melee strike of a Natural 20 that is confirmed as a critical hit, this item will strike your foe with a tremendous burst of lightning. A DC 100 Reflex save will prevent half of this damage.
%b1 Strength of Purpose: You gain a %v1 %b1 Bonus to Unconsciousness Range, and regenerate 16 Hit Points using Positive Healing every 10 seconds.
Striding %v1%: Makes the wearer more fleet of foot, giving a %v1% bonus to run speed.
Subtle Target: Once per minute, when you use Diplomacy, you gain a -100% Profane bonus to threat generation with weapon strikes for 20 seconds.
Summer's Impertinence: The heat of Summer surrounds you. +20% Enhancement bonus to critical damage with fire and light spells.

Sun Burst: This weapon flashes an intense burst of sunlight on any critical hit. The target is blasted for 6 to 36 of light damage and is blinded as well. Oozes and Undead take 12 to 72 light damage. A successful DC 22 Reflex save reduces the damage by half and negates the blindness.

Sundering IV: On Hit: Your target suffers a -1 Penalty to Fortitude Saving Throws for 6 seconds. This effect stacks up to 5 times. This effect may only occur on-hit once every three seconds. Passive: The DC of the saving throw to resist your Sunder combat feats is increased by 8.

Sundering V: On Hit: Your target suffers a -1 Penalty to Fortitude Saving Throws for 6 seconds. This effect stacks up to 5 times. This effect may only occur on-hit once every three seconds. Passive: The DC of the saving throw to resist your Sunder combat feats is increased by 10.

Sundering VI: On Hit: Your target suffers a -1 Penalty to Fortitude Saving Throws for 6 seconds. This effect stacks up to 5 times. This effect may only occur on-hit once every three seconds. Passive: The DC of the saving throw to resist your Sunder combat feats is increased by 11.

Sundering VII: On Hit: Your target suffers a -1 Penalty to Fortitude Saving Throws for 6 seconds. This effect stacks up to 5 times. This effect may only occur on-hit once every three seconds. Passive: The DC of the saving throw to resist your Sunder combat feats is increased by 12.

Sundering VIII: On Hit: Your target suffers a -1 Penalty to Fortitude Saving Throws for 6 seconds. This effect stacks up to 5 times. This effect may only occur on-hit once every three seconds. Passive: The DC of the saving throw to resist your Sunder combat feats is increased by 13.

Sundering IX: On Hit: Your target suffers a -1 Penalty to Fortitude Saving Throws for 6 seconds. This effect stacks up to 5 times. This effect may only occur on-hit once every three seconds. Passive: The DC of the saving throw to resist your Sunder combat feats is increased by 14.
Sunsword's Power: The Sunsword holds the power to render Strahd vulnerable to weapon damage for a short period of time.
Superior Acid Resistance: This property absorbs the first 40 points of Acid damage per attack that the wearer would normally take.
Superior Cold Resistance: This property absorbs the first 40 points of cold damage per attack that the wearer would normally take.

Superior Disruption: On Hit: 4 to 24 Bane damage to Undead. On Vorpal Hit: If an undead struck by this weapon has fewer than 2500 Hit Points, it is instantly slain. If the undead has above 2500 Hit Points, it takes 250 damage.
Superior False Life: This item grants the wearer +40 maximum health.
Superior Fire Resistance: This property absorbs the first 40 points of fire damage per attack that the wearer would normally take.

Superior Force Burst: This weapon is humming with magical force. The weapon deals an extra 2 to 12 Force damage each hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 2 to 20 force damage for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 4 to 40 for a x3 critical multiplier and 6 to 60 for a x4 multiplier.
Superior Heroism: Passive: +5 Morale bonus to all your attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.
Superior Lightning Resistance: This property absorbs the first 40 points of Electric damage per attack that the wearer would normally take.

Superior Nimbleness: This suit of armor looks much less restrictive than others of its type. A suit of armor that has this property has a maximum Dexterity bonus 4 higher than normal, and its armor check penalty is reduced by 4.
Superior Reinforced Fists: This item surrounds your fists with kinetic energy. Your unarmed damage is boosted by one and one half die.
Superior Stability: This armor grants a +6 Deflection bonus to AC and a +6 Resistance bonus to saves for characters of True Neutral alignment.
Superior Undead Guard: This armor burns those Undead that attack the wearer, causing 7d8 Good damage on a successful melee attack.
Vorpal: Passive: +0.5[W] damage dice. On a Vorpal Strike: If your target has fewer than 2500 hit points, it is instantly slain. If your target has above 2500 hit points, it takes 250 damage.

Suppress Madness: This strange creature is enchanted with the ability to temporarily filter the maddening effects of certain Xoriat items. Wearing it will suppress the effects of the following: Curse Vector, Unwieldy, Overfocus, Mind Turbulence, Symbiotic Backlash, Metal Fatigue, Power Drain, and Single-Mindedness.
Suppressed Power: This psionic item is powerful, but you sense that it has not unlocked all of its secrets to you at this time.
Supreme Good: This weapon is infused with the supreme Power of Good. It does an additional 3 to 18 damage to non-good targets and can only be wielded by Good-aligned characters.
Supreme Law: This weapon is infused with the supreme Power of Law. It does an additional 3 to 18 damage to non-lawful targets and can only be wielded by Lawful-aligned characters.

Swim like a Fish: While this item is equipped and you are swimming, you gain the Evasion feat. Evasion causes you to take no damage on a successful Reflex saving throw against an effect which would normally allow half damage on a successful Reflex save.
Symbiotic Backlash: This item is symbiotic and grants you benefits, but it also deals 2 to 12 extra damage to you when enemies roll a 20 on an attack against you.

Symbiotic Flexibility: Because this suit of armor has merged with your body, the flexibility it affords you is practically unparalleled. A suit of armor that has this property has a maximum Dexterity bonus 4 higher than normal, and its armor check penalty is reduced by 4.
Taint of Chaos: Lawful aligned characters equipping this item suffer a temporary negative level until the item is removed.
Taint of Evil: Good aligned characters equipping this item suffer a temporary negative level until the item is removed.
Tchurvul's Touch: This weapon causes running sores that make the target of its blows extremely irritable. There is a small chance that creatures lose -1 Charisma when hit by this weapon.
Telekinesis Guard: When enemies hit you, they may be assaulted by these psychic forces, falling to the ground unless they make a DC 35 Reflex save.
Telekinetic: Targets that suffer a critical hit from a Telekinetic weapon must make a DC 17 Balance check or be knocked down.
Temperance of Belief: You have a +1 Quality bonus to Magical Resistance Rating per Religious Lore feat.
Temperance of Spirit: You have a +1 Quality Bonus to Physical Resistance Rating per Religious Lore Feat.

Tempest: This item is one of two pieces of the Tempest set. When both items are equipped your weapons will deal 1d4 additional slashing damage. If you have the Tempest Capstone enhancement, this item will give your weapons an additional +3 to hit bonus. This bonus stacks with all other effects.
Tet-zik, The Enlightened Change: Whispers of the ancients grant you the ancient martial secrets of the Thri-Kreen. Your elemental Monk stances grant additional bonuses.
Tendon Slice %v1: On Hit: 6% chance to slow target's movement by 50% for %v1 seconds.

The Artblade's Gift: You gain Legendary Concordant Opposition: Being struck in melee has a small chance to return some lost Hit Points and Spell Points to you. Offensive spells have a chance to grant 100 Temporary Spell Points. This has a one minute cooldown, which is shared with effects that grant Legendary Concordant Opposition.

The Dragging of the Depths 4: Attuned to the dark depths of the waves below, this weapon is cold to the touch and unholy. Each hit drains life from your enemies, dealing 4d6 Evil damage, and when striking Good enemies, it also deals an additional 4d6 Cold damage.

The Dragging of the Depths 6: Attuned to the dark depths of the waves below, this weapon is cold to the touch and unholy. Each hit drains life from your enemies, dealing 6d6 Evil damage, and when striking Good enemies, it also deals an additional 6d6 Cold damage.

The Falling Star: On hit, this weapon has a chance to put down a falling star upon your foes, dealing 90d6 Fire Damage and 30d6 Bludgeoning Damage to enemies caught within the blast. This blast is so powerful it has a chance to knock nearby enemies down upon impact.

The Golden Curse: A strange inscription winds around this artifact. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked, occasionally an incredible power comes to the surface, shielding its weilder in solid gold to protect from further attacks.
The Moral Compass: An oft repeated mantra of the Shintao is written on these sacred handwraps:
"True strength comes from within, and true power comes from rising above." While wearing these handwraps, Monks will gain additional power and bonuses based on their Philosophy.
With at least 3 Monk levels you gain:

Axiomatic 6: This weapon is righteous and wielded by those who stand against chaos, dealing an additional 6d6 law damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon lawfully aligned. Chaotic characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Holy 6: This weapon is wielded by the pure to smite the wicked, dealing an additional 6d6 good damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon good aligned. Evil characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level. Requires Feat: Path of Inevitable Dominion
Unholy 6: Unholy 6: On Hit: 6 to 36 Evil damage. Requires Feat: Path of Harmonious Balance

Thaarak Corrosion: Like a Thaarak Hound's vitriolic breath, this weapon is corrosive and can damage enemies over time. Occasionally, it applies a lasting effect to its targets that deals 2 to 8 acid damage every two seconds for six seconds. If the effect is reapplied before it has a chance to wear off, the duration will reset and stack up to three times.

The Mummy's Gift: Being struck in melee has a chance to return some lost Hitpoints and Spellpoints to you. Offensive spells have a chance to return 100 temporary spellpoints. This has a one minute cooldown.

The Reaver's Resolve: While the Stormreaver was a guest of The Celestial One, Ternathear, some know that he wallowed for a time in drink. He had lost everything he had once held dear- even his prized blade, Cloudburst. After a group of adventurers defeated his former lieutenant, the storm giant lich Sor'jek Incanni, the Stormreaver resolved to take matters into his own two hands. (This enchantment has no effect.)
Thief Acrobat: This item in one of two pieces of the Thief Acrobat set. When both items are equipped you will gain a +15 Competence to Jump and weapons will have a chance to unbalance an opponent.
Thok-zik, The Earth-Change: +5 Critical Hit and Critical Confirmation, +10 PRR
Thok-zik, The Earth-Change: This item surrounds your fists with kinetic energy. Your unarmed damage is boosted by one half die.
Thorn Guard: This armor stings those that attack the wearer, causing 1 to 8 piercing damage on a successful melee attack.
Thorn Guard +4: When you are hit or missed in combat, this item has a chance to deal 4d8 Piercing damage on hit.
Thorn Guard +6: When you are hit or missed in combat, this item has a chance to deal 6d8 Piercing damage on hit.
Thorn of the Rose: Your attacks have a chance to Exhaust your enemies with no save.

Thorny Crown of Madness 6: This legendary weapon resonates with cruel and delightful madness. Strikes with this weapon have a chance to confuse your target, allowing them to harm and be harmed by friend and foe alike. Furthermore, hits with this weapon against Confused targets deal an additional 6d6 Chaos damage.

Thorny Crown of Madness 7: This legendary weapon resonates with cruel and delightful madness. Strikes with this weapon have a chance to confuse your target, allowing them to harm and be harmed by friend and foe alike. Furthermore, hits with this weapon against Confused targets deal an additional 7d6 Chaos damage.

Thrill of the Hunt: "Lesser beings hunt for the prize, but for me, the hunt is prize enough." On Hit: You have a small chance to attempt to hold a monster in place. Even if the Hold is unsuccessful, their will saves will be reduced by 5.

Thunderbane: This weapon was crafted in the great Thunderforge before the Dragons came. Against constructs and the undead, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +8 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 7 to 42 points of damage against the foes.

Thunderclap: This potent ability will in certain cases send forth a cacophony of sound. On an attack roll of 20, which is confirmed as a critical hit, the target may suffer the following conditions: Stunned, Knockdown, and Disorient.

Thundering: A thundering weapon creates a cacophonous roar when striking a successful critical hit. A thundering weapon deals an extra 1 to 8 points of sonic damage upon a successful critical hit with a weapon that has a x2 critical multiplier, an extra 2 to 16 for a x3 multiplier, and an extra 3 to 24 for x4 multiplier.
%b1 Thunderstorm Lore %v1: Passive: Your Sonic and Lightning spells gain a %v1 %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Thunderstruck: On Melee Vorpal Hit: 35-60 Electric and 35-60 Sonic damage to your target.
Tidal: This weapon is sheathed in water. A tidal weapon deals an extra 1 to 4 points of damage on a successful hit. Creatures with the Fire trait take double this damage instead.
Tidal 2: This weapon is sheathed in water. A Tidal weapon deals an extra 2d6 points of damage on a successful hit. Creatures with the Fire trait take double this damage instead.
Tidal 4: This weapon is sheathed in water. A Tidal weapon deals an extra 4d6 points of damage on a successful hit. Creatures with the Fire trait take double this damage instead.
Tidal 6: This weapon is sheathed in water. A Tidal weapon deals an extra 6d6 points of damage on a successful hit. Creatures with the Fire trait take double this damage instead.

Tidal Burst: This weapon is sheathed in water. The weapon deals an additional 1 to 4 damage each hit. In addition, critical hits deal an additional 1 to 8 damage for weapons with a x2 critical multiplier, 2 to 16 for a x3 critical multiplier and 3 to 24 for a x4 multiplier. Creatures with the Fire trait take double this damage instead.
Tira's Splendor: Any weapon you wield becomes able to bypass silver damage reduction.
Titania's Warmth: The Queen of Summer sends her regards... Attacks and offensive spells have a chance to grant 1000 temporary hitpoints. This has a one minute cooldown.
Touch of Immortality: Passive: While this item is equipped, you gain a +20 Competence Bonus to the Heal and Repair skills, and you regenerate 2-4 Hit Points every 15 seconds.

Touch of the Mournlands: This staff, once wielded by the Lord of Blades himself, taints each wound with the power of the Mournlands. Prolonged exposure will make the target more and more difficult to heal and repair, cutting their Healing and Repair Amplification, and also interferes with their ability to use magic by occasionally Quelling enemies on a Vorpal strike.
Touched by Wild Magic: See beyond your fate and destiny. This deck of Tarokka Cards is beyond your comprehension.

Toxic: This weapon oozes with magical poisons from a dozen esoteric sources. Occasionally, these toxins will erupt on your target, unleashing a vile fog that will dissolve your foes with acid, and will additionally deal constitution damage to enemies whom are not immune to poison. Weak foes may be killed outright by this Toxic Cloud.
Toxic 12: This effect causes the edges of this weapon to drip with a vile venom, dealing 12d6 poison damage on each critical hit.
Transform Kinetic Energy: Each time you are hit in melee combat there is a chance that the energy of the blow will be converted into Spell Points.

Transmuted Platinum: This weapon, made of transmuted platinum, is slightly magically unstable, and has a chance to transfer its magic to those it strikes. Struck enemies have a small chance to turn into transmuted platinum, preventing all movement, with a DC of 35 negating this effect.

Trap the Soul: This equipment stores an overwhelming, merciless power deep within. When you strike an enemy with a melee or missile attack, this power occasionally comes to the surface, sucking out the life force of an enemy and imprisoning the essence of their body and soul in a gem.

Trap the Soul Guard: This item stores an overwhelming, merciless power deep within. When the wearer of this item is successfully attacked in melee, this power occasionally comes to the surface, sucking out the life force of an enemy and imprisoning the essence of their body and soul in a gem.
Treason: This item reduces the threat generated by melee damage by 20%.
Tropical Winter Wonderland: This item allows the wearer to move gracefully over the icy surfaces in the Risia Ice Games. You will move with greater speed and will be less likely to fall.
True Chaos: This weapon is infused with the power of True Chaos. It does an additional 1 to 6 damage to non-chaotic targets and can only be wielded by Chaotic-aligned characters.
True Law: This weapon is infused with the power of True Law. It does an additional 1 to 6 damage to non-lawful targets and can only be wielded by Lawful-aligned characters.
True Seeing: Passive: You gain the benefit of the spell True Seeing.

Turbulent Burst: This weapon is enchanted with wild, unpredictable energy. It will do 1 to 8 damage of a random energy type (fire/cold/electric/acid) on a successful hit and 3 to 24 damage of a random energy type on critical hits.
Turning: This will increase the total number of Turn Undead attempts you can use by 3. However, these additional Turn Undead attempts will only take effect after the wielder rests.
Twilight: This suit of armor, favored by Eladrin spell casters, becomes semi-incorporeal when donned. The twilight armor reduces the chance of arcane spell failure by -10%.
Twining Hemlock: This weapon is poisoned with a deadly strain of flowering plant. Hits by this weapon have a chance of putting your foe to sleep.
Unbalancing: Anything that melee attacks a character with an Unbalancing item has a chance to be pulled off balance giving them a -2 penalty to their AC.

Undead Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Undead, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.
Undead Bane 2: Those that have died must return, and this weapon is attuned specifically to lay them to rest. This weapon deals an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Undead.
Undead Bane 3: Those that have died must return, and this weapon is attuned specifically to lay them to rest. This weapon deals an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Undead.
Undead Bane 4: Those that have died must return, and this weapon is attuned specifically to lay them to rest. This weapon deals an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Undead.
Undead Bane 5: Those that have died must return, and this weapon is attuned specifically to lay them to rest. This weapon deals an additional 5d10 bane damage vs. Undead.
Undead Bane 6: Those that have died must return, and this weapon is attuned specifically to lay them to rest. This weapon deals an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Undead.
Undead Guard: This armor burns those Undead that attack the wearer, causing 3d8 Good damage on a successful melee attack.
Undersun: While this item is equipped in areas with Underdark radiation, your sight is augmented to allow you to discern your surroundings even with little or no light.
Underwater Action: This item grants the wearer the ability to breathe water as if it were air.
%b1 Undying %v1: Bound to service beyond death, you gain a %v1 %b1 bonus to your Incapacitation range.

Unholy Burst 6: This weapon is a sinister implement of evil deeds, dealing 6d6 Evil damage on a successful hit to Good enemies, and 14d6 Evil damage on a critical hit to Good enemies. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Unholy 2: This weapon is used by the wicked to smite the pure, dealing an additional 2d6 evil damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Unholy 3: This weapon is used by the wicked to smite the pure, dealing an additional 3d6 evil damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Unholy 4: This weapon is used by the wicked to smite the pure, dealing an additional 4d6 evil damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Unholy 5: This weapon is used by the wicked to smite the pure, dealing an additional 5d6 evil damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Unholy 6: This weapon is used by the wicked to smite the pure, dealing an additional 6d6 evil damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Unholy 7: This weapon is used by the wicked to smite the pure, dealing an additional 7d6 evil damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.

Unholy 8: This weapon is used by the wicked to smite the pure, dealing an additional 8d6 evil damage on each hit. This effect makes the weapon evil aligned. Good characters wielding this weapon will suffer one negative level.
%b1 Universal Spell Power %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 bonus to Universal Spell Power.
%b1 Universal Spell Lore %v1: %v1 %b1 bonus to Universal Spell Lore.
Unnatural: Items so profane can have unintended consequences... This item will uncenter you and break your druidic oath.
Unnatural Bane 4: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt beings that should not exist, dealing an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Aberrations, Monstrous Humanoids, and Undead.
Unnatural Bane 5: This weapon is attuned specifically to hunt beings that should not exist, dealing an additional 5d10 bane damage vs. Aberrations, Monstrous Humanoids, and Undead.

Unraveling Enchantments: The enchantments on this item have become unstable and weakened with time, but those serving House Deneith may be able to restore it. Combine this item in Visbane's Folly atop Sentinel's Tower in House Deneith Enclave with a Sigil of the Goat, a Sigil of the Lion, and a Sigil of the Dragon to restore its original enchantments.
Unstoppable Staggering Blow: On a Vorpal strike with a Melee weapon, this weapon will trip your opponent, forcing them to fall prone for 2 seconds. There is no save against this effect.
Unwieldy: This weapon is very large and makes you clumsier as you wield it, causing a -2 Dexterity penalty.
Upgradeable - Tier 2: This is a tier 2 upgradeable item.

Utter Disintegration: This weapon has a dark, insidious power deep within. Occasionally, this power lashes out violently at enemies and attempts to disintegrate them. This disintegrate is incredibly powerful, and will utterly destroy weaker foes.

Utter Disintegration Guard: This item has a dark, insidious power deep within. Occasionally, this power lashes out violently at enemies that strike you and attempts to disintegrate them. This disintegrate is incredibly powerful, and will utterly destroy weaker foes.
Vampirism: This weapon drains a tiny portion of the target's life force whenever it does damage. (Note: Provides 1d3 hp of healing per hit.)
Vampirism 1: This weapon thirsts for the blood of your enemies, healing you for +1d2 hit points with each hit.
Vampirism 2: This weapon thirsts for the blood of your enemies, healing you for +2d2 hit points with each hit. (Note: Internal cooldown of 1 second.)
Vampirism 3: This weapon thirsts for the blood of your enemies, healing you for +3d2 hit points with each hit. (Note: Internal cooldown of 1 second.)
Vengeful: When its wielder is hit in battle, this item has a 10% chance to cause him or her to become full of anger and go into a Rage.
Vengeful Fury: On Taking Damage: Gain a 12% Enhancement Bonus to Doublestrike and a +4 Rage Bonus to your Attack Bonus.
Venomed Ammunition - 1d2: On Ranged Attack: 1 to 2 Poison Damage
Venomed Ammunition - 1d3: On Ranged Attack: 1 to 3 Poison Damage
Venomed Ammunition - 1d4: On Ranged Attack: 1 to 4 Poison Damage
Venomed Ammunition - 1d6: On Ranged Attack: 1 to 6 Poison Damage
Venomed Ammunition - 1d8: On Ranged Attack: 1 to 8 Poison Damage
Venomed Ammunition - 1d10: On Ranged Attack: 1 to 10 Poison Damage
Venomscale: Adds Cold Iron material type. On hit: 15d6 Poison Damage.

Vermin Bane: A bane weapon excels at attacking one type or subtype of creature. Against Vermin, this weapon's effective enhancement bonus is +2 better than its normal enhancement bonus. It deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage against the foe.
Vermin Bane 2: This weapon is ideal for cleaning out rats and other annoying beasts. It deals an additional 2d10 bane damage vs. Vermin.
Vermin Bane 3: This weapon is ideal for cleaning out rats and other annoying beasts. It deals an additional 3d10 bane damage vs. Vermin.
Vermin Bane 4: This weapon is ideal for cleaning out rats and other annoying beasts. It deals an additional 4d10 bane damage vs. Vermin.
Vermin Bane 5: This weapon is ideal for cleaning out rats and other annoying beasts. It deals an additional 5d10 bane damage vs. Vermin.
Vermin Bane 6: This weapon is ideal for cleaning out rats and other annoying beasts. It deals an additional 6d10 bane damage vs. Vermin.
%b1 Vertigo %v1: This effect gives a %v1 %b1 bonus to the DC to resist the character's Trip and Improved Trip attempts.

Vicious: When a vicious weapon strikes an opponent, it creates a flash of disruptive energy that resonates between the opponent and the wielder. This energy deals an extra 2 to 12 points of damage to the opponent and 1 to 3 points of damage to the wielder.
Hand Vile Grip of the Hidden Hand: Attacks and offensive spells have a small chance to deal massive evil damage.
Virtuoso: This item in one of two pieces of the Virtuoso set. When both items are equipped you gain an additional bard song after resting, and Extend Spell costs 2 Spell Points less.
Vitality %v1: Passive: %v1 Vitality bonus to Hit Points.
Voice of Deceit: Passive: +20 Competence bonus to Bluff, Diplomacy, Haggle, and Perform skills.
%b1 Void Lore %v1%: Passive: Your Negative Energy and Poison spells gain a %v1% %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
%b1 Void Lore %i1: Passive: Your Negative Energy and Poison spells gain a %v1% %b1 bonus to their chance to critical hit.
Voltaic: This weapon is sheathed in Powerful electricity. A voltaic weapon deals an extra 2 to 12 points of electricity damage on a successful hit.
Vorpal: Passive: +0.5[W] damage dice. On Vorpal Hit: If your target has fewer than 1000 Hit Points, they are instantly slain. If your target has above 1000 Hit Points, they take 100 damage.
On Vorpal: Applies a stack of Lethargy (-1 to all Saving Throws. Non-bosses also move and attack 5% slower. This effect stacks up to 5 times.)
Vulkoor's Bite: Vulkoor calls to you, and death answers. Attacks and offensive spells have a chance to deal 1d3 Negative levels.
Vulnerable: You take 1% more damage for 3 seconds. This effect stacks up to 20 times, and loses one stack on expiration.

Vulnerability Guard: This item stores powerful erosive forces. When the wearer is missed in combat, this power occasionally releases a degrading blast, adding three stacks of vulnerability to all enemies nearby.
Wailing: Shrieking weapons emit a haunting wail whenever they are used to make a successful attack. This wail deals an additional 3 to 18 sonic damage.

Warchanter: This item in one of two pieces of the Warchanter set. When both items are equipped you gain an additional bard song after resting, Maximize Spell costs 4 Spell Points less, and Extend Spell will cost 1 Spell Point less.

Warpriest: This item in one of two pieces of the Warpriest set. When both items are equipped you gain two additional Turn Undead attempts after resting, and +2 Exceptional bonus to hit with Melee attacks.

Water Savant: This item in one of two pieces of the Water Savant set. When both items are equipped, Water spells gain a +5% chance to critical hit. Water spell critical damage is increased by 0.5 to the spell critical multiplier.
Weaken Construct: While wearing this item, your attacks cause constructs to lose 20% of their Fortification for the next 20 seconds. This effect does not stack with itself.
Weaken Construct: While wearing this item, your attacks cause constructs to lose 20% of their Fortification for the next 20 seconds. This effect does not stack with itself.
Weaken Undead: While wearing this item, your attacks cause undead creatures to lose 20% of their Fortification for the next 20 seconds. This effect does not stack with itself.
Weakening: This weapon drains the enemies' melee power. -1 Strength on a successful hit.
Weakening 1: This weapon saps the power and might from your enemies, dealing 1 Strength damage on each hit.
Weakening 2: This weapon saps the power and might from your enemies, dealing 2 Strength damage on each hit.
Weakening 3: This weapon saps the power and might from your enemies, dealing 3 Strength damage on each hit.
Weaken Undead: While wearing this item, your attacks cause undead creatures to lose 20% of their Fortification for the next 20 seconds. This effect does not stack with itself.
%v1 Enhancement Bonus: %v1 Enhancement bonus to attack and damage rolls.
-1 Enhancement Bonus: This weapon is less well-made than normal, giving a -1 penalty to attack and damage rolls.
Weapon Focus: Falchion: While equipped this item gives you the feat Weapon Focus: Slashing but only for Falchions, giving a +1 to your attack bonus while using Falchions.
Weapon Focus: Thrown: While equipped this item grants the feat Weapon Focus: Piercing, giving a +1 to your attack bonus when using all thrown weapons.
Wisdom Skills - Exceptional Bonus %v1: Passive %v1 Exceptional bonus to the Wisdom based skills of: Heal, Listen and Spot
Web Immunity: This item grants the wearer the ability to move and attack freely through webs of all kinds.
Weighty Asset: This item is so heavy you find it hard to be dragged anywhere - even to your grave. You benefit from a +100 Enhancement bonus to increased unconsciousness range.
Whelming Shockwave: This weapon reverberates with incredible power. On Vorpal, this weapon triggers a Shockwave, striking its target with bludgeoning damage and dealing damage to surrounding enemies.
Whirlwind Ward: This effect renders you immune to being knocked down by an Air Elemental's whirlwind. However, it does not prevent you from being knocked back or away from touching the Air Elemental.

Wild Frenzy: This weapon has a tendency to drive those it strikes insane. On an attack roll of 20 which is confirmed as a critical hit the target will go wild and attack its own allies for 15 seconds if it fails a DC 25 Will save. Enemies driven wild in this way, however, have a chance of coming to their senses if damaged.
Set Bonus: This item is one of the two pieces of the Wild Mage set. When both items are equipped all of your Level 8 and lower spells gain +2 to the die to penetrate target's Spell Resistance.
%b1 Will Save %v1: This item gives a %v1 %b1 bonus to your Will save.
Winged Allure: The butterflies of this crown have a tendency to distract your enemies. When hit or missed in melee combat, your foes have a chance to be Fascinated with no save.
Winter's Impertinence: The chill of Winter surrounds you. +20% Enhancement bonus to critical damage with force and negative spells.

%b1 Wizardry %i1: Passive: %v1 %b1 Bonus to Spell Points. If you have Sorcerer or Favored Soul levels, you gain additional spell points proportionate to the ratio of those levels to other heroic classes.

%b1 Wizardry %v1: Passive: %v1 %b1 Bonus to Spell Points. If you have Sorcerer or Favored Soul levels, you gain additional spell points proportionate to the ratio of those levels to other heroic classes.
Wondrous Craftsmanship: This item's enchantments are more Powerful than is normal for an item of this level. (+2 Total Enhancement Value.)
Wounding: A wounding weapon deals 1 point of Constitution damage from blood loss when it hits a creature. Creatures immune to critical hits are immune to the Constitution damage dealt by this weapon.

Wounding 1: A wounding weapon deals 1 point of Constitution damage from blood loss when it hits a creature. Creatures immune to critical hits are immune to the Constitution damage dealt by this weapon.

Wounding 2: A wounding weapon deals 2 points of Constitution damage from blood loss when it hits a creature. Creatures immune to critical hits are immune to the Constitution damage dealt by this weapon.

Wounding 3: A wounding weapon deals 3 points of Constitution damage from blood loss when it hits a creature. Creatures immune to critical hits are immune to the Constitution damage dealt by this weapon.
Wrath of the Zealot: You gain a Sacred bonus to Damage equal to half your Religious Lore feats.
